term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - haze horizon in atmospheric chemistry
term.title: haze horizon

item.text: The top of a haze layer which is confined by a low-level temperature inversion so that it gives the appearance of the horizon which it may obscure.

sources.item: PAC, 1990, 62, 2167. 'Glossary of atmospheric chemistry terms (Recommendations 1990)' on page 2193 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199062112167)
